commit_message:
Add utility function to compose URL from elements

This change introduces the generic function to compose URL from
elements. This can be used to compose endpoint url or coordination
backend url.

Change-Id: I77469f9dca817c4ab2af939de9bd74dce122c3d8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib refs/changes/98/877898/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper' describe 'os_url' do it 'refuses String' do is_expected.to run.with_params('foo').\ and_raise_error(Puppet::ParseError, /Requires an hash/) end it 'refuses Array' do is_expected.to run.with_params(['foo']).\ and_raise_error(Puppet::ParseError, /Requires an hash/) end it 'refuses without at least one argument' do is_expected.to run.with_params().\ and_raise_error(Puppet::ParseError, /Wrong number of arguments/) end it 'refuses too many arguments' do is_expected.to run.with_params('foo', 'bar').\ and_raise_error(Puppet::ParseError, /Wrong number of arguments/) end it 'refuses extra params passed as String' do is_expected.to run.with_params({ 'extra' => 'key=value' }).and_raise_error(Puppet::ParseError, /extra should be a Hash/) end it 'fails if port is provided with missing host' do is_expected.to run.with_params({ 'port' => '8080', }).and_raise_error(Puppet::ParseError, /host is required with port/) end context 'creates the correct connection URI' do it 'with all parameters' do is_expected.to run.with_params({ 'dialect' => 'https', 'host' => '127.0.0.1', 'port' => '443', 'path' => '/test', 'username' => 'guest', 'password' => 's3cr3t', 'extra' => { 'key' => 'value', 'read_timeout' => '60' } }).and_return('https://guest:s3cr3t@127.0.0.1:443/test?key=value&read_timeout=60') end it 'without port' do is_expected.to run.with_params({ 'host' => '127.0.0.1', 'path' => '/test', 'username' => 'guest', 'password' => 's3cr3t', 'extra' => { 'key' => 'value' } }).and_return('http://guest:s3cr3t@127.0.0.1/test?key=value') end it 'without host and port' do is_expected.to run.with_params({ 'dialect' => 'file', 'path' => '/test', 'extra' => { 'key' => 'value' } }).and_return('file:///test?key=value') end it 'without username and password' do is_expected.to run.with_params({ 'host' => '127.0.0.1', 'port' => '8080', 'path' => '/test', 'extra' => { 'key' => 'value' } }).and_return('http://127.0.0.1:8080/test?key=value') end it 'with username set to undef' do is_expected.to run.with_params({ 'host' => '127.0.0.1', 'port' => '8080', 'path' => '/test', 'username' => :undef, 'extra' => { 'key' => 'value' } }).and_return('http://127.0.0.1:8080/test?key=value') end it 'with username set to an empty string' do is_expected.to run.with_params({ 'host' => '127.0.0.1', 'port' => '8080', 'path' => '/test', 'username' => '', 'extra' => { 'key' => 'value' } }).and_return('http://127.0.0.1:8080/test?key=value') end it 'without password' do is_expected.to run.with_params({ 'host' => '127.0.0.1', 'port' => '8080', 'path' => '/test', 'username' => 'guest', 'extra' => { 'key' => 'value' } }).and_return('http://guest@127.0.0.1:8080/test?key=value') end it 'with password set to undef' do is_expected.to run.with_params({ 'host' => '127.0.0.1', 'port' => '8080', 'path' => '/test', 'username' => 'guest', 'password' => :undef, 'extra' => { 'key' => 'value' } }).and_return('http://guest@127.0.0.1:8080/test?key=value') end it 'with password set to an empty string' do is_expected.to run.with_params({ 'host' => '127.0.0.1', 'port' => '8080', 'path' => '/test', 'username' => 'guest', 'password' => '', 'extra' => { 'key' => 'value' } }).and_return('http://guest@127.0.0.1:8080/test?key=value') end end end

commit_message:
Stop testing amqp1 messaging driver

amqp1 driver of the oslo.messaging library was deprecated and it is
no longer tested. This replaces usage of the driver by the RabbitMQ
driver.

commit_message:
Replace integration job by litmus job

qpid dispatch router is no longer tested in integration tests, because
the amqp1 driver has been deprecated. This replaces the integration
tests by litmus tests so that we can keep testing basic deployment
functionality.

Depneds-on: https://review.opendev.org/891326

commit_message:
CI: Stop setting docker_restart_policy to "no"

In the past it made sense, because we wanted to catch all container
issues (without a restart loop or similar bells and whistles).
Since we implemented systemd approach, docker_restart_policy = "no"
means we don't install systemd units - and that's somewhat bad
for catching CI errors in that implementation.

Change-Id: I294e0c2226d5b9f0506368b1fd020f36bb5fc0cb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/27/878427/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Decorate only Flavor.get_* methods that execute queries
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-07-14 02:56:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/flavor.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9ae6240c92e212b2fa96d5163f68ef1b30ee03b7', 'message': "Decorate only Flavor.get_* methods that execute queries

The get_* methods on the Flavor object use a common helper method to
build a query object to execute later.

Currently, the @api_db_api.context_manager.reader decorator which
manages the session is located on the helper method instead of on the
methods that actually execute the database queries. Part of the context
manager's job is to close the session after the query is executed.
Because the decorator is not on the methods that actually execute the
queries, those database connections are not being closed and it will
eventually lead to errors like:

  sqlalchemy.exc.TimeoutError: QueuePool limit of size 5 overflow 50
  reached, connection timed out, timeout 30.00 (Background on this
  error at: https://sqlalche.me/e/14/3o7r)

which means the connection pool size plus the overflow size has been
reached and the pool will block for a fixed period of time before
timing out and raising this error.

This removes the @api_db_api.context_manager.reader decorator from the
query build helper method and adds it to the Flavor.get_* methods that
execute the database queries.

Closes-Bug: #2027755

Change-Id: I4bf83d1642b62ab103716aff6dae7438646e2b31
"}]
commit_message:
Decorate only Flavor.get_* methods that execute queries

The get_* methods on the Flavor object use a common helper method to
build a query object to execute later.

Currently, the @api_db_api.context_manager.reader decorator which
manages the session is located on the helper method instead of on the
methods that actually execute the database queries. Part of the context
manager's job is to close the session after the query is executed.
Because the decorator is not on the methods that actually execute the
queries, those database connections are not being closed and it will
eventually lead to errors like:

  sqlalchemy.exc.TimeoutError: QueuePool limit of size 5 overflow 50
  reached, connection timed out, timeout 30.00 (Background on this
  error at: https://sqlalche.me/e/14/3o7r)

which means the connection pool size plus the overflow size has been
reached and the pool will block for a fixed period of time before
timing out and raising this error.

This removes the @api_db_api.context_manager.reader decorator from the
query build helper method and adds it to the Flavor.get_* methods that
execute the database queries.

Closes-Bug: #2027755

Change-Id: I4bf83d1642b62ab103716aff6dae7438646e2b31
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/13/888513/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _flavor_get_query_from_db(context): # We don't use a database context decorator on this method because this # method is not executing a query, it's only building one. @api_db_api.context_manager.reader @api_db_api.context_manager.reader @api_db_api.context_manager.reader

commit_message:
Remove Glance v1 APIs tests code

Glance v1 APIs were removed in Rocky and tempest master
does not support the Rocky release. If glance v1 APIs
needs to be tested for older release then older Tempest
can be used.

Tempest is removing the Glance v1 APIs tests, config option,
and its service clients and this change is needed for that.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/890592
Change-Id: I3f285c025bdf0c3b08b51efd157de77dcfd057c6

commit_message:
chore: refactor ovn support

This makes the OVN support more robust, refactors certain shared
components with the normal metadata agent, fixes proper init
container handling and much more(tm).

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/+/889187
Change-Id: I09512c89f44a78796353a12c61f075a181fa8cd5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/58/889258/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ovn:
deleted_lines: mechanism_drivers: ovn overlay_ip_version: 4 ml2_type_geneve: vni_ranges: 1:65536 max_header_size: 38 securitygroup: enable_security_group: True firewall_driver: neutron.agent.linux.iptables_firewall.OVSHybridIptablesFirewallDriver ovn: ovn_nb_connection: tcp:__OVN_NB_DB_SERVICE_HOST__:__OVN_NB_DB_SERVICE_PORT__ ovn_sb_connection: tcp:__OVN_SB_DB_SERVICE_HOST__:__OVN_SB_DB_SERVICE_PORT__ enable_distributed_floating_ip: True ovn_metadata_enabled: True ovn_metadata_agent: DEFAULT: # we cannot change the proxy socket path as it is declared # as a hostPath volume from agent daemonsets metadata_proxy_socket: /var/lib/neutron/openstack-helm/metadata_proxy metadata_proxy_shared_secret: "password" metadata_workers: 2 nova_metadata_host: __NOVA_METADATA_SERVICE_HOST__ cache: enabled: true backend: dogpile.cache.memcached ovs: ovsdb_connection: tcp:127.0.0.1:6640 ovsdb_timeout: 180 ovn: ovn_metadata_enabled: True ovn_nb_connection: tcp:__OVN_NB_DB_SERVICE_HOST__:__OVN_NB_DB_SERVICE_PORT__ ovn_sb_connection: tcp:__OVN_SB_DB_SERVICE_HOST__:__OVN_SB_DB_SERVICE_PORT__

commit_message:
Remove Glance v1 APIs tests code

Glance v1 APIs were removed in Rocky and tempest master
does not support the Rocky release. If glance v1 APIs
needs to be tested for older release then older Tempest
can be used.

Tempest is removing the Glance v1 APIs tests, config option,
and its service clients and this change is needed for that.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/890592
Change-Id: Ib7bbb274256a7e1d1e308adbd416d243ad7f8b54

deleted_lines: from tempest.common import image as common_image } if CONF.image_feature_enabled.api_v1: params['is_public'] = 'False' params['properties'] = properties params = {'headers': common_image.image_meta_to_headers(**params)} else: params['visibility'] = 'private' # Additional properties are flattened out in the v2 API. params.update(properties) if CONF.image_feature_enabled.api_v1: self.image_client.update_image(image['id'], data=image_file) else: self.image_client.store_image_file(image['id'], image_file)

commit_message:
Wait for new ovs ctl file

Sometimes the poststart function on a pod restart
completes too quickly, resulting in chown command
running on the incorrect file.

Change-Id: I2eca5b148f13c48314501c955723bf759ffaa4fc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/26/891226/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: find_latest_ctl_file() { latest_file="" latest_mtime=0 for file in /run/openvswitch/*.ctl; do if [ -f "$file" ] && [ "$(stat -c %U "$file")" == "root" ]; then current_mtime=$(stat -c %Y "$file") if [ "$current_mtime" -gt "$latest_mtime" ]; then latest_file="$file" latest_mtime="$current_mtime" fi fi done echo "$latest_file" } # Wait for potential new ctl file before continuing timeout=5 start_time=$(date +%s) while true; do latest_ctl_file=$(find_latest_ctl_file) if [ -n "$latest_ctl_file" ]; then break fi current_time=$(date +%s) if (( current_time - start_time >= timeout )); then break fi sleep 1 done

commit_message:
Copy default configuration files to /etc/

This will allow us to shorten the values.yaml
in many cases.

This is disabled by default. Set COPY_DEFAULT_CONFIG_FILES=yes
to enable it.

Change-Id: I244c29844d3ceb29b73e9a60b284d900bbeeb4ec

commit_message:
Add support for share snapshot metadata

Change-Id: I94161e084d5412a4de67f765cfa6e7793b57e4a6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/70/890870/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # ========= Snapshot Metadata ========== def get_share_snapshot_metadata(self, snapshot_id): """Lists all metadata for a snapshot. :param snapshot ID: The ID of the snapshot. :returns: One or more metadata key and value pairs as a dictionary of strings. :rtype: :class:`~openstack.shared_file_system.v2.share_snapshot.ShareSnapshot` """ snapshot = self._get_resource(_share_snapshot.ShareSnapshot, snapshot_id) return snapshot.fetch_metadata(self) def get_share_snapshot_metadata_item(self, snapshot_id, key): """Retrieves a specific metadata item from a snapshot's metadata by its key. :param snapshot_id: The ID of the snapshot :param key: The key of the snapshot metadata :returns: A single metadata key and value pair :rtype: :class:`~openstack.shared_file_system.v2.snapshot.SnapshotMetadata` """ snapshot = self._get_resource(_share_snapshot.ShareSnapshot, snapshot_id) return snapshot.get_metadata_item(self, key) def create_share_snapshot_metadata(self, snapshot_id, **metadata): """Creates a snapshot metadata as key-value pairs. :param snapshot_id: The ID of the snapshot :param metadata: The metadata to be created :returns: One or more metadata key and value pairs as a dictionary of strings. :rtype: :class:`~openstack.shared_file_system.v2.snapshot.SnapshotMetadata` """ snapshot = self._get_resource(_share_snapshot.ShareSnapshot, snapshot_id) return snapshot.set_metadata(self, metadata=metadata) def update_share_snapshot_metadata(self, snapshot_id, metadata, replace=False): """Replaces the metadata for a given snapshot with the metadata in the request object :param snapshot_id: The ID of the snapshot to update :param metadata: The metadata to be updated :param replace: Boolean for whether the preexisting metadata should be replaced :returns: One or more metadata key and value pairs as a dictionary of strings. :rtype: :class:`~openstack.shared_file_system.v2.snapshot.SnapshotMetadata` """ snapshot = self._get_resource(_share_snapshot.ShareSnapshot, snapshot_id) return snapshot.set_metadata(self, metadata=metadata, replace=replace) def delete_share_snapshot_metadata(self, snapshot_id, keys): """Deletes a single metadata item on a snapshot, identified by its key. :param snapshot_id: The ID of the snapshot :param keys: The keys of a metadata item to be deleted :returns: None :rtype: None """ snapshot = self._get_resource(_share_snapshot.ShareSnapshot, snapshot_id) keys_failed_to_delete = [] for key in keys: try: snapshot.delete_metadata_item(self, key) except exceptions.NotFoundException: if not ignore_missing: self._connection.log.info("Key %s not found.", key) keys_failed_to_delete.append(key) except exceptions.ForbiddenException: self._connection.log.info("Key %s cannot be deleted.", key) keys_failed_to_delete.append(key) except exceptions.SDKException: self._connection.log.info("Failed to delete key %s.", key) keys_failed_to_delete.append(key) if keys_failed_to_delete: raise exceptions.SDKException( "Some keys failed to be deleted %s" % keys_failed_to_delete )

commit_message:
Install libldap-common for keystone

Is the package is not installed it's not possible to validate the
tls cert of the ldap-server.

This package went from depends to suggests in jammy release.

Change-Id: Ia9e2e35d3898727af67c4d07115bad6d0582dda4

commit_message:
Fix linters and metadata

With update of ansible-lint to version >=6.0.0 a lot of new
linters were added, that enabled by default. In order to comply
with linter rules we're applying changes to the role.

With that we also update metdata to reflect current state.

Change-Id: Ib390f06177fbac77a4285e3be86e6461fd769597

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-09 15:12:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystonemiddleware/commit/b9f2fdd230809031658ba29af7a299abe0d310bc', 'message': 'Add Python3 antelope unit tests

commit_message:
Switch to 2023.1 Python3 unit tests and generic template name

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for antelope. Also,
updating the template name to generic one.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: I8227da5a3f63845cb0151c329237d280fd3d5521

commit_message:
Fix hosts.toml template for containerd

The issue is that playbook that configures containerd
defines buildset registry namespace w/o skip_verify
parameter which leads to the error in the template.

This change add additional check whether skip_verify
parameter is defined or not.

Change-Id: I7b6f19d4fe881e33fef2370bac887e9cd66c7b35

subject: haproxy: fix health checks for serialconsole in http mode
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-08-04 12:54:46.000000000', 'files': ['inventory/group_vars/nova_all/haproxy_service.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/3d6e5cb167a559d219dd8fbea4ada9bfcd146d47', 'message': "haproxy: fix health checks for serialconsole in http mode

The serialconsole proxy appears to be a very simple WebSocket
proxy with no obvious support for many HTTP methods. As such
a HEAD or GET to / returns a 405.

This patch adjusts the expected status code to ensure the service
isn't marked as down, but it is worth noting that the health
checks do make the serialproxy service logs a little noisy.

Change-Id: Ie2e06c99b9c99435e29a321b373d6a937f4123f4
"}]
commit_message:
haproxy: fix health checks for serialconsole in http mode

The serialconsole proxy appears to be a very simple WebSocket
proxy with no obvious support for many HTTP methods. As such
a HEAD or GET to / returns a 405.

This patch adjusts the expected status code to ensure the service
isn't marked as down, but it is worth noting that the health
checks do make the serialproxy service logs a little noisy.

Change-Id: Ie2e06c99b9c99435e29a321b373d6a937f4123f4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/20/890520/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

I don't believe this is necessary anymore since 'management_ip'
was introduced into openstack_user_config.

Whether 'management_ip' is set or not, 'management_address' is

Change-Id: I0565eeffd599cc90119420edc18ed37aea80b0db
"}]
commit_message:
Remove dynamic-address-fact call which is no longer required

I don't believe this is necessary anymore since 'management_ip'
was introduced into openstack_user_config.

Whether 'management_ip' is set or not, 'management_address' is
already set in the inventory, and if dynamic-address-fact runs
here it can confusingly override the value of 'management_address'.

Change-Id: I0565eeffd599cc90119420edc18ed37aea80b0db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/06/890306/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Refactor LXC image expiration

Right now we write output of `date -d @{{ timestamp }} to
the expiry file, and then attempt to comapre with timestamp.
However, output of  `date -d` is datetime and not timestamp,
so these 2 things can not be properly compared. So image cache
was valid forever.

Change-Id: I42f5b43f09d3c530813dd7fd334eafce7a5eaf39

commit_message:
[CI] Drop test config workaround in standalone jobs

devstack seems to honor local.conf's test-config
properly now, and this workaround is no longer
necessary.

commit_message:
Allow directly output cluster config

Allow cluster config directly return configs instead of writing file.
This is useful when using magnum client utils from non-commandline
interfaces.

Change-Id: Ie6717e1f2d673fe3e92c58a926a82f255a6d20ca

test runtime for antelope lead us to the following error:


The qpid driver has been deprecated and removed since a while.

Functional tests remains. However, note that neither debian nor ubuntu

A recent oslo.messaging patch [1], not yet merged, who aim to update the
test runtime for antelope lead us to the following error:

```
qdrouterd: Python: ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'qpid_dispatch'
```

Neither debian nor ubuntu in the latest releases have any binary
built for the qpid backend, not even 3rd party. Only qpid proton,
the client lib, is available.

To solve this issue, these changes propose to deprecate the AMQP1 driver
who is the one based on qpid and proton, and propose to remove the
related functional tests.

commit_message:
Deprecate the amqp1 driver and Remove qpid functional tests

A recent oslo.messaging patch [1], not yet merged, who aim to update the
test runtime for antelope lead us to the following error:

```
qdrouterd: Python: ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'qpid_dispatch'
```

Neither debian nor ubuntu in the latest releases have any binary
built for the qpid backend, not even 3rd party. Only qpid proton,
the client lib, is available.

To solve this issue, these changes propose to deprecate the AMQP1 driver
who is the one based on qpid and proton, and propose to remove the
related functional tests.

The AMQP1 driver doesn't seems to be widely used.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/oslo.messaging/+/856643

Closes-Bug: 1992587
Change-Id: Id2ca9cd9ee8b8dbdd14dcd00ebd8188d20ea18dc

commit_message:
[OVN] ovn-db-sync check for router port differences

Prior to this patch the ovn-db-sync script did not check if the router
ports were actually out-of-sync before marking them to be updated. This
behavior introduced irrelevant information in the sync report (specially
when ran in "log" mode) making the user think that the databases were
out-of-sync even when they were not.

This patch adds the code checking for differences in the Neutron Router
Ports and OVN Logical Router Port entries prior to updating them.

Change-Id: Id7bf5a6aa547795ba78724eed59ba9d4fb74f758
Closes-Bug: #2030773
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-03-23 16:13:43.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/python_venv_wheel_build.yml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'vars/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-role-python_venv_build/commit/36f97d2c899ee776fca31d2c0c91cf69066a3582', 'message': "DNM/POC/RFC Allow multi distro/arch builds

This patch could/should probably be split in two, one for syncing
and one for building.

Building:
  We check all the hosts in the ansible_play_batch for distro/arch
exactly the same as venv_build_targets, and then we flatten that
structure to a list of venv_build_requesters. The
python_venv_wheel_build was set to run_once, because we only needed
it to build once for the single distro/arch, but now we can pick
out one host for every distro/arch and have it request a build to
it's corresponding repo_container/distro/arch via venv_build_host.

Synchronizing:
  If packages are built on repo_all[0] we just move them into
venv_build_host_wheel_path, and if on any other host, we rsync the
files over to repo_all[0] for further distribution. (Shamelessly
ripped from the old repo_build.)

My suggestion would be two patches,
1) sync
2) building with a depends on sync

Thoughts?

Change-Id: Ib6ecea1eaaf5dfdedf4e683c1ae1b5619dcbabf4
"}]
commit_message:
DNM/POC/RFC Allow multi distro/arch builds

This patch could/should probably be split in two, one for syncing
and one for building.

Building:
  We check all the hosts in the ansible_play_batch for distro/arch
exactly the same as venv_build_targets, and then we flatten that
structure to a list of venv_build_requesters. The
python_venv_wheel_build was set to run_once, because we only needed
it to build once for the single distro/arch, but now we can pick
out one host for every distro/arch and have it request a build to
it's corresponding repo_container/distro/arch via venv_build_host.

Synchronizing:
  If packages are built on repo_all[0] we just move them into
venv_build_host_wheel_path, and if on any other host, we rsync the
files over to repo_all[0] for further distribution. (Shamelessly
ripped from the old repo_build.)

My suggestion would be two patches,
1) sync
2) building with a depends on sync

Thoughts?

Change-Id: Ib6ecea1eaaf5dfdedf4e683c1ae1b5619dcbabf4

commit_message:
Add stable/2023.1 jobs on master gate

As 2023.1 is released, we should add its job on master
gate to keep branchless tempest plugins compatible
to stable branch.

Ref: Tempest plugins guide for stable branch testing:
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_testing_policy.html

Change-Id: I59f29bcbf667f6598b00022eff4088ed324f1610

commit_message:
Support PKCE with v3oidcdeviceauthz

In case the OAuth 2.0 client for keystone is configured in Keycloak to
require PKCE (for horizon Web-SSO), this also applies to other flows
like v3oidcdeviceauthz.

https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7636

Signed-off-by: Arvid Requate <requate@univention.de>
Change-Id: I8475a583844d9b97ed65a9909c31cebc31cfbebb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth refs/changes/52/883852/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import base64 import hashlib import os client_id, client_secret=None, code_challenge=None, code_challenge_method=None, :param code_challenge_method: PKCE Challenge Method (RFC 7636). :type code_challenge_method: string self.code_challenge_method = code_challenge_method def _generate_pkce_verifier(self): """Generate PKCE verifier string as defined in RFC 7636""" raw_bytes = 42 # 32 is the minimum from the RFC, let's use a bit more _rand = os.urandom(raw_bytes) _rand_b64 = base64.urlsafe_b64encode(_rand).decode('ascii') code_verifier = _rand_b64.rstrip('=') # strip padding as RFC prescribes return code_verifier def _generate_pkce_challenge(self): """Generate PKCE challenge string as defined in RFC 7636""" if self.code_challenge_method not in ('plain', 'S256'): raise exceptions.OidcGrantTypeMissmatch() self.code_verifier = self._generate_pkce_verifier() if self.code_challenge_method == 'plain': return self.code_verifier elif self.code_challenge_method == 'S256': _tmp = self.code_verifier.encode('ascii') _hash = hashlib.sha256(_tmp).digest() _tmp = base64.urlsafe_b64encode(_hash).decode('ascii') code_challenge = _tmp.rstrip('=') return code_challenge payload = {} if self.code_challenge_method: self.code_challenge = self._generate_pkce_challenge() payload.setdefault('code_challenge_method', self.code_challenge_method) payload.setdefault('code_challenge', self.code_challenge) encoded_payload = urlparse.urlencode(payload) data=encoded_payload, if self.code_challenge_method: payload.setdefault('code_verifier', self.code_verifier)

commit_message:
Automate generation of services api-ref samples

This patch adds the following tests with microversion 3.32 for:

1) Set log level for service
2) Get log level for service

Partially-Implements: blueprint generating-sample-files
Change-Id: If471dbe61fa8c3f57bd998d53b737c89d3ee03e9
Signed-off-by: Toheeb <toheeb.olawale.to23@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add litmus job

We are removing qdr from integration job because amqp1 driver of
the oslo.messaging library has been deprecated. This adds the litmus
test to cover basic deployment scenario.

Change-Id: I35cfbe0893ecae44b92f8c43983e09f61996d9b3

commit_message:
Fix an undefined variable bug for venus deployment

The external_protocol variable does not exist, resulting in an error
during the venus deployment process. This commit will fix that.

Closes-Bug: #2029353

Change-Id: I2d983eecd8861689fdab7d60bdb9dd34ea0c159e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/21/890321/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add .pdkignore to exclude some files from tar ball

We've seen release job failures caused by too large tarball, which
contains irrelevant files like git history.

Let's exclude these files to reduce size of the archive.

The file is copied from the puppetlabs repositories with some files
specific to OpenStack projects added.

Change-Id: Ie9a6706e1977efafcaad799ac6a68a966c9bb693
(cherry picked from commit 6ab903b68ad0bc42b5122f07d2f60d01c88776b1)
(cherry picked from commit 89006bb424188354048870a8bd401d88af92641a)

contains irrelevant files like git history.

Let's exclude these files to reduce size of the archive.

The file is copied from the puppetlabs repositories with some files
specific to OpenStack projects added.

commit_message:
Add .pdkignore to exclude some files from tar ball

We've seen release job failures caused by too large tarball, which
contains irrelevant files like git history.

Let's exclude these files to reduce size of the archive.

The file is copied from the puppetlabs repositories with some files
specific to OpenStack projects added.

Change-Id: I4e28e76d8253da823d725aa9b3d708912c429c05
(cherry picked from commit 7710f9970ba2772f996b9b9da064313b82f51499)

revisions:

nodes, like:

commit_message:
Fix issue that Ceph Mon/Mgr are deployed on wrong roles

When we deploy both DistributedComputeHCIScaleOut and
DistributedComputeHCI, Ceph Mon and Mgr are wrongly deployed on
DistributedComputeHCIScaleOut nodes.
This bug comes from the wrong regex to find out DistributedComputeHCI
nodes, like:

  wrong regex: .*-distributedcomputehci

This wrong regex matches both DistributedComputeHCIScaleOut and
DistributedComputeHCI, because their default HostHostnameFormat are:

  DistributedComputeHCI: %stackname%-distributedcomputehci-%index%
  DistributedComputeHCIScaleOut: %stackname%-distributedcomputehciscaleout-%index%

By this change, the regex will be:

  new regex: .*-distributedcomputehci-\d+$

Change-Id: I6b37c09dea08928e9945de710d036aea99e997b3
Resolves: rhbz#2226963
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/45/889845/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pat = host_fmt.replace('%stackname%', '.*').replace('%index%', r'\d+') + '$'

commit_message:
[solum] Transition Rocky to End of Life

As discussed in the mail thread [1][2], this patch transition the Rocky
branch to End of Life. The last patch of the branch will be tagged with
rocky-eol tag. stable/rocky branch cannot be used anymore and will be
deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/rocky is not actively maintained in recent
period, thus gates are mostly broken due to job failures. Besides,
by removing these branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/rocky is deleted. Propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

[1] https://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2023-January/031922.html
[2] https://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2023-April/033386.html

Change-Id: I8ac8f485f29318bd469621bd30406d62fa3c3bc7

commit_message:
Add .pdkignore to exclude some files from tar ball

We've seen release job failures caused by too large tarball, which
contains irrelevant files like git history.

Let's exclude these files to reduce size of the archive.

The file is copied from the puppetlabs repositories with some files
specific to OpenStack projects added.

Change-Id: Ifdb9d32c7dd5f4b849982dfd3424602f381a1ef8
(cherry picked from commit 782dd2aec4de431629fa1e213cec3aaf963fdb2a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-heat refs/changes/08/891408/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Ubuntu: Switch to Focal and Victoria

We already have OpenStack Victoria releae available in cloud archive
so let's switch our master tests to that latest version.
Since Victoria release is only available in Focal this change also
switch base Ubuntu version from Bionic to Focal.

Conflicts:
	zuul.d/layout.yaml
	zuul.d/libraries.yaml
	zuul.d/unit.yaml

Change-Id: Ie78b6ef1c3f09fbbc3bc584ac99d2a0acfc5d9d9
(cherry picked from commit fe029254fd5f9f89b3ae042eca8c1e474ad7493c)

commit_message:
Add stable/zed jobs on master gate

As zed is released, we should add its job on master
gate to keep branchless tempest plugins compatible
to stable branch.

Removing the EM stable branch job.

Ref: Tempest plugins guide for stable branch testing:
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_testing_policy.html

Change-Id: Ia5fa823e084bda91231b1a4394b038bccaa52d97

commit_message:
Pin stable branch jobs nodeset to Ubuntu Focal (20.04)

In 2023.1 cycle. we are moving the default distro
version of Ubuntu to Jammy (22.04)[1] so we need to pin
the nodeset for stable branch job in master gate so that
they continue run on their supporting distro version which is
Ubuntu Focal since stable/victoria.

Also fixing the zuul config error.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/migrate-ci-jobs-to-ubuntu-jammy.html

Change-Id: Idc2968bc23e208e78ab254d55ebd2cf3ad58f50e

commit_message:
Add stable/2023.1 jobs on master gate

As 2023.1 is released, we should add its job on master
gate to keep branchless tempest plugins compatible
to stable branch.

Remove stable/xena dnw allaby jobs as they are in EM state.

Ref: Tempest plugins guide for stable branch testing:
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_testing_policy.html

Change-Id: I5ef70cd33ab42ad626e8b8c332491c72e0ae0c25

commit_message:
Clean generated source RST files

The tox docs env generates RST files in doc/source/contributor/api/
and these aren't updated when modules are removed from the glance
source code, and can cause errors trying to build the docs.  So
clean this dir out (like we do with doc/build/) before building
the docs.

Change-Id: I47e8ceccecadb469c27cbf203fe77528cc38d95d

commit_message:
Add section about stable-only patches

In some projects the [stable-only] 'tag' is used in the commit message
title of a patch on a stable branch - if the given patch is not a
backport - to mark the patch that it was added intentionally to a
given stable branch directly, as for some reason the patch does not
apply on master or newer branches.

Change-Id: I1e9c604ae8be40e6e5797b491850c28e039d61aa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-team-guide refs/changes/61/810661/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Branch-specific patches ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ For some cases there are patches that are needed only on a specific stable branch (for example CI fixes or special bug fixes that does not apply on newer branches as for example a feature implementation has removed the given code, etc). In these patches it is good to indicate, for example in the title of the commit message, that it is a ``[stable-only]`` patch. `As an example see this patch. <https://review.opendev.org/780991>`_ By adding ``[stable-only]`` in the title helps the reviewers to see that the patch is intentionally not a backport / added to a stable branch instead of implementing it on master branch.

commit_message:
Extend and clarify the section about when security fixes are acceptable

The underlying idea here is that OpenStack gate should test a sitution
which is near the end user situation where the end user will run against
a security patched version of the dependency (which potentially includes
stricter or slightly changed behavior) and we want to ensure that
OpenStack is both compatible with and not relying on previously
vulnerable code path behavior.

Change-Id: Ie332f35f2a49df8f2c18550f6607be7f63b01677
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-team-guide refs/changes/55/660855/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Changing the effectively used version or the version specifiers for a dependency is only acceptable during `Maintained Phase`, and can be acceptable for * documenting upper caps that need to be followed (example a newer release was made that removes python 2.x support, but we still rely on a version that has python 2.x support) * excluding known insecure versions to ensure gating tests are run including the new behavior of the dependencies with security fixes being in effect. If a effective version change or version exclude is done due to a security vulnerability and that change requires or is required by a change in OpenStack, these must be announced via a OSSN notice to the OpenStack users in a timely fashion alongside the requirements change.
deleted_lines: Changing the effectively used version for a dependency is only acceptable during `Maintained Phase`, and only due to security issues.

commit_message:
Update global-requirements stable policy to match reality

This should reflect the current modus operanti and not include
any actual policy change. With the community effort around
moving the lower dependency tracking into the individual project
this fell slightly out of date. Also the stable policy adjusted
itself so we need to update the phase reference.

Change-Id: Ic5d032a964cc7c7e203ca66983a99c2211b4e7b9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-team-guide refs/changes/53/660853/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: within the OpenStack community. Exceptions are made for dependencies of OpenStack projects when there are gate issues. Those updates must be proposed by hand and carefully reviewed and cross-checked with vendors.As of the OpenStack Rocky release, the purpose of Global-requirements no longer includes specifing minimum acceptable versions. Starting with Rocky the minimum required versions are tracked in the individual projects instead. Global-requirements still specifiers the "excluded" versions of a particular given dependency. For releases older than OpenStack Rocky, global-reqirements used to track excluded and minimum acceptable versions, and in some cases upper caps as well. Changing the effectively used version for a dependency is only acceptable during `Maintained Phase`, and only due to security issues. .. _Maintained Phase: https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#maintenance-phases
deleted_lines: within the OpenStack community. Exceptions are made for other projects when there are gate issues. Those updates must be proposed by hand.These should be few and far between on stable branches, mainly masking known bad versions or in extreme adding a maximum version allowable for a package. We work to remove these caps as well. Raising effective minimums is only acceptable during `Phase I`, and only due to security issues. .. _Phase I: https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#support-phases

commit_message:
Add SLURP release notes strategy

The aim of this patch is:
- make clear what the TC suggests doing
- make clear why the TC thinks it should be done this way
- give a helpful example of how to do it

Change-Id: I90b7600866d0d99b5cfccecb2bda9f2505ef4b27
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-team-guide refs/changes/57/843457/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Release Notes for SLURP Releases -------------------------------- Beginning with the 2023.1 OpenStack release, each "dot-one" release will be designated a SLURP (Skip Level Upgrade Release Process) release. Such a release will support upgrades from either the immediate previous release (that is, following the traditional OpenStack upgrade process) or from the previous SLURP release. (See the `Release Cadence Adjustment <https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20220210-release-cadence-adjustment.html>`_ resolution for details.) An implication of supporting both the SLURP and the traditional release process is that operators upgrading from one SLURP to the next SLURP will not see the release notes from the release in between the SLURPs. At the same time, operators who follow the traditional release upgrade process should not have to read these intermediate release notes twice. (This is because if people are forced to re-read a bunch of stuff, it is more likely that their eyes will glaze over and they'll miss something new and important.) Thus, we need to make the intermediate release notes easily discoverable from the SLURP release notes, both so that they don't clutter up the SLURP notes and so that they are easily available for operators who haven't already read them. Discovery will be enhanced if all projects follow the same basic structure for doing this, which is outlined below. Let's pretend that Wallaby was a SLURP release, Xena was the next non-SLURP release, and Yoga was a SLURP release. Deployers following the SLURP strategy will upgrade directly from Wallaby to Yoga, skipping Xena. Further, suppose that Yoga has not been released yet, and you are finalizing the Yoga (second SLURP) release notes now. #. Generate a static page of the Xena (Yoga SLURP minus 1) release notes. * from the root directory of the project repo: :: $ tox -e releasenotes --notest $ .tox/releasenotes/bin/reno report \ --title "Xena Release Notes" \ --branch "stable/xena" | \ sed 's/^ *$//g' > "releasenotes/source/xena-static.rst" * a few points to note: * The title heading in the "regular" release notes is always "X Series Release Notes". Note that we're using something different, namely, "X Release Notes". This is because reno uses the title when generating anchors in the ``.rst`` file, and we need the anchors in the static document to be unique. * Make sure that you include "-static" in the filename being written to. There will already be a ``xena.rst`` file in the directory and we don't want to overwrite it. (That file is used for the "regular" release notes for the series, which will continue to be generated in the normal way as patches are backported following the normal backport process.) * Why use this extra static ``.rst`` file? For two reasons: * Any release notes associated with changes since the coordinated release (that is, the x.0.0 release) are already included in the SLURP release's notes, because the OpenStack backport process dictates that changes must be merged to release *n*\+1 before they can be merged to release *n*. We don't want these to be duplicated. * Having a static ``.rst`` file available will allow you to include anchors in the static file so that your SLURP release notes can link to specific items in the static page. #. Edit the static release notes page. * Using cinder as an example, the original Xena release was version 19.0.0, and Xena 19.1.0 has been released, and some other fixes have been merged into the stable/xena branch. We want the static file to contain *only* the release notes for 19.0.0. So if you hadn't thought ahead and generated the static page at the time of the 19.0.0 release, you'll have to remove the extraneous stuff by hand. Joking aside, there's a good reason to wait until the last minute to generate the static file because, given the way reno works, corrections to release notes in stable branches must be made directly to the stable branch, and if you had actually generated the static file early, you'd miss any corrections. When you're done, the top of the static ``.rst`` file should look like this: :: ================== Xena Release Notes ================== .. _Xena Release Notes_19.0.0_stable_xena: 19.0.0 ====== .. _Xena Release Notes_19.0.0_stable_xena_Prelude: Prelude ------- .. releasenotes/notes/xena-release-prelude-2190d8c515dbedc1.yaml @ b'0700979bb8fddc79d80c325efd4f352fde955b44' Welcome to the Xena release of the OpenStack Block Storage service (cinder) ... * One more change needs to be made to the static ``.rst`` file. We aren't going to include it in the toctree; instead we'll link to it from the SLURP release notes. So we need to add an ``:orphan:`` directive at the top of the page so that sphinx doesn't generate a warning (which the openstack releasenotes job treats as an error, thereby failing your releasenotes build). It should be the first non-comment non-whitespace characters in the file: :: :orphan: ================== Xena Release Notes ================== etc. * Don't forget to do a 'git add' to the static file, because you will need to commit it to the repository. #. Add a link to the static page from the SLURP release notes. * The final task is to add a point to the "Prelude" section of the SLURP release that contains a link to the static page. You do this in a regular reno ``.yaml`` file. For example, :: --- prelude: | Welcome to the Yoga release of the OpenStack Block Storage service (cinder) ... * Something important about this release. * Another important thing to mention. * **This is a SLURP release.** If you are upgrading directly from the previous SLURP release (Wallaby), we recommend that you read through the :doc:`release notes from the intermediate release <xena-static>` (Xena). There may be items of such importance from an intermediate non-SLURP release that a project team may wish to reemphasize them in the SLURP release notes. That's perfectly OK. We just ask that you do this judiciously so that deployers don't think that they can completely ignore the other notes from the intermediate release (which must be important, or why did you write them in the first place?). Since the intermediate non-SLURP release notes are being kept in a static ``.rst`` document, you don't have to repeat entire notes. Instead, you can add an anchor to the particular item you want to highlight, and then link to it from the SLURP release notes. Finally, as of this writing, we haven't actually had a SLURP release yet. So we fully expect the release note process to evolve as both project teams and deployers adapt to it. But hopefully this simple approach is a good start.

commit_message:
Drop deprecated keystone::client

The class was used to install the keystoneclient package but
the package no longer provides CLI.

The openstackclient package is now installed by the keystone class,
using the openstacklib::openstackclient class included, so we no longer
have to include that deprecate class.

Change-Id: I0085beb0487ecc25bcc29fdc1f7b2521ca67b61e

commit_message:
Add stable/2023.1 jobs on master gate

As 2023.1 is released, we should add its job on master
gate to keep branchless tempest plugins compatible
to stable branch.

Ref: Tempest plugins guide for stable branch testing:
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_testing_policy.html

Change-Id: Ie4dacf5ecb567f29a93b998b89b97ea874e02fda

commit_message:
Remove stable/wallaby job from master gate

stable/wallaby is in EM state. As Tempest and
plugins masters does not support EM stable branches,
QA team is pinning tempest in devstack stable/wallaby
tesitng[1]. With that we do not need to test the
stable/wallaby jobs on master gate

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/871782

Change-Id: I79c6c5a676695b22135b21f8b4837f77bd2eb876

commit_message:
Remove reference to 'all-plugin' tox environment

The 'all-plugin' tox environment was deprecated by this patch [1].
Instead of the 'all-plugin' it is recommended to use the 'all' tox
environment.

This patch removes any reference to 'all-plugin' tox environment and
updates the documentation so that the installation steps work with
the 'all' venv.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/543974

Change-Id: Ic9c5cc65611c12211be35d9d65c75d67ab717302

deleted_lines: navigate to tempest directory:: Run this command:: $ tox -e all-plugin -- solum_tempest_plugin $ tox -e all-plugin -- solum_tempest_plugin.camp.v1_1.test_plans.TestPlansController.test_create_camp_plan

subject: Fix several issues in the lock/release database code
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-07-06 13:12:47.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/c6610c2f7f739b020831bb36e3acd3afec416961', 'message': "Fix several issues in the lock/release database code

Major:
- Result's first() does not raise NoResultFound, it returns None.
- Avoid opening a read transaction while a write transaction is active.

Minor:
- Do not handle NoResultFound where it cannot happen (or is already
  handled).
- Only load the fields we use when fetching intermediate results.
- Do not load the node the 2nd time when releasing: the detection of
  the exact error is racy anyway.

Change-Id: I099c7b782e0a633908383958e7aed2b17c8c3864
"}]
commit_message:
Fix several issues in the lock/release database code

Major:
- Result's first() does not raise NoResultFound, it returns None.
- Avoid opening a read transaction while a write transaction is active.

Minor:
- Do not handle NoResultFound where it cannot happen (or is already
  handled).
- Only load the fields we use when fetching intermediate results.
- Do not load the node the 2nd time when releasing: the detection of
  the exact error is racy anyway.

Change-Id: I099c7b782e0a633908383958e7aed2b17c8c3864
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/35/887835/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Must already be # locked. raise exception.NodeLocked(node=node.uuid, host=node.reservation) # Check existence and convert UUID to ID node = self._get_node_reservation(node_id) if node.reservation: # Fail fast, instead of attempt the update. raise exception.NodeLocked(node=node.uuid, host=node.reservation) # Check existence and convert UUID to ID node = self._get_node_reservation(node_id) with _session_for_write() as session: res = session.execute( sa.update(models.Node). where(models.Node.id == node.id). where(models.Node.reservation == tag). values(reservation=None). execution_options(synchronize_session=False) ) session.flush() if res.rowcount != 1: if node.reservation is None: raise exception.NodeNotLocked(node=node.uuid) else: raise exception.NodeLocked(node=node.uuid, host=node.reservation) def _get_node_reservation(self, node_id): with _session_for_read() as session: # Explicitly load NodeBase as the invocation of the # primary model object results in the join query # triggering. res = session.execute( add_identity_filter( sa.select(models.NodeBase.id, models.NodeBase.uuid, models.NodeBase.reservation), node_id ).limit(1) ).first() if res is None: else: return res

Must already be # locked. raise exception.NodeLocked(node=node.uuid, host=node.reservation) except NoResultFound: # In the event that someone has deleted the node on # another thread. raise exception.NodeNotFound(node=node_id) with _session_for_read() as session: try: # TODO(TheJulia): Figure out a good way to query # this so that we do it as light as possible without # the full object invocation, which will speed lock # activities. Granted, this is all at the DB level # so maybe that is okay in the grand scheme of things. query = session.query(models.Node) query = add_identity_filter(query, node_id) node = query.one() except NoResultFound: raise exception.NodeNotFound(node=node_id) if node.reservation: # Fail fast, instead of attempt the update. raise exception.NodeLocked(node=node.uuid, host=node.reservation) with _session_for_read() as session: try: query = session.query(models.Node) query = add_identity_filter(query, node_id) node = query.one() except NoResultFound: raise exception.NodeNotFound(node=node_id) with _session_for_write() as session: try: res = session.execute( sa.update(models.Node). where(models.Node.id == node.id). where(models.Node.reservation == tag). values(reservation=None). execution_options(synchronize_session=False) ) node = self.get_node_by_id(node.id) if res.rowcount != 1: if node.reservation is None: raise exception.NodeNotLocked(node=node.uuid) else: raise exception.NodeLocked(node=node.uuid, host=node['reservation']) session.flush() except NoResultFound: raise exception.NodeNotFound(node=node_id) def _get_node_by_id_no_joins(self, node_id): # TODO(TheJulia): Maybe replace with this with a minimal # "get these three fields" thing. try: with _session_for_read() as session: # Explicitly load NodeBase as the invocation of the # priamary model object reesults in the join query # triggering. res = session.execute( sa.select(models.NodeBase).filter_by(id=node_id).limit(1) ).scalars().first() except NoResultFound: return res

commit_message:
Fix file matchers for loci jobs

In this PR https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm-images/+/887596
while debugging we removed the zuul.d/openstack-loci.yaml file
as a job dependency. This prevented upload and promote jobs
to be launched.

Also recently we switched to multinode compute-kit jobs
for some Openstack releases where we deploy Kubernetes
using Kubeadm with Containerd as a container runtime.

These multinode compute-kit jobs are not fully compatible with
the role use-buildset-registry which is used to configure
image registry to test new images.

There are two issues:
- use-buildset-registry role expects root user has a valid kube
  config file
- use-buildset-registry configures docker to use private zuul
  registry, but for multinode compute-kit environment we need
  to configure containerd instead

So, for now we redefine the openstack-helm-images-compute-kit-zed-ubuntu_focal
job, so it uses single node compute-kit env.

Change-Id: I48e9e8be55a3213c380110cdc3b3b3211732e65d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-images refs/changes/83/890083/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - zuul.d/openstack-loci.yaml

commit_message:
Configure containerd mirrors for multinode tests

The compute-kit jobs are used to test new images
which are published to buildset registry. We have
to configure containerd which is used for multinode
compute-kit jobs to use this buildset registry.

The role use-buildset-registry that we used before
does not properly configure containerd. So we
extended deploy-docker playbook to configure
both buildset registry and registry mirror
if they are defined.

Change-Id: Idb892a3fcaf51385998d466dbdff8de36d9dd338

commit_message:
Fix up inconsistent max_count argument in o-d-ms

About two thirds of our online data migrations are using 'count' as
the name for the limit argument, where the others (and the runner)
call it max_count. This makes them all consistent with the original
intent.

Change-Id: I33a4afdef0f19bf667af616b1ba2b032d166b546

commit_message:
Set backup status to error on VolumeNotFound

When creating a backup and it fails we will try
to update the status on the volume but if it does
not exist we will instead fail on that and the
backup will be stuck in creating status which means
cloud admin need to help resetting the status.

This catches the VolumeNotFound exception and ignores
updating the volume status and thus backup will be
set to error and can be deleted by user instead.

Closes-Bug: #1996049
Change-Id: Iafa92ece7f83323af257c1702df5029469b11739
(cherry picked from commit 813df9b99f23bdc54787a0c918e47f9d61df3232)

subject: Skip failing tests affected by minimum password age
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-08-07 13:30:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/4774a31b98f4639fa3700b4f0236ee735d0ff04d', 'message': "Skip failing tests affected by minimum password age

Some identity api tests are failing, when keystone parameter
minimum_password_age is set to value greater than 0. It causes inability
to update user's password more than once per test suite. As in this test
suite it is required total of four times, this patch suggests skipping
these tests to avoid complicated workaround.

This bug has been discussed in several patches [1][2].

Additionaly, config option for user_minimum_password_age is added into
tempest/config.py, to allow users to work with this keystone parameter.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/806671
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/838726

commit_message:
Skip failing tests affected by minimum password age

Some identity api tests are failing, when keystone parameter
minimum_password_age is set to value greater than 0. It causes inability
to update user's password more than once per test suite. As in this test
suite it is required total of four times, this patch suggests skipping
these tests to avoid complicated workaround.

This bug has been discussed in several patches [1][2].

Additionaly, config option for user_minimum_password_age is added into
tempest/config.py, to allow users to work with this keystone parameter.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/806671
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/838726

Related-Bug: #1946459
Change-Id: I418e4001b0aa27f10a78f3490cc233293c30c274

commit_message:
Support sha256/sha512 with the ilo firmware upgrade logic

Adds support for SHA256 and SHA512 checksums to be passed
to firmware upgrade steps for the ilo hardware type.

Change-Id: I5455c4bfa4741a35b0ddada37298c897887e6cea

commit_message:
Use OSC in run-evacuate-hook instead of novaclient

Recently a change landed in devstack [1] to install packages into a
global venv by default and the "nova" command was not symlinked for
compat, so jobs using run-evacuate-hook are failing with:

  nova: command not found

We had intended to switch away from using novaclient CLI commands in our
scripts anyway, so we can just use this opportunity to switch to OSC.

[1]: If9bc7ba45522189d03f19b86cb681bb150ee2f25

Change-Id: Ifd969b84a99a9c0460bceb1a28fcee6e51cbb4ae

commit_message:
Fix pool names in RadosGW charm

The latest Ceph versions forbid pool names that start with a dot.
Since the RadosGW charm uses pools named so extensively, this
patchset fixes that issue.

In addition, the Ceph libraries are synced as well, since they
were outdated.

Change-Id: I50112480bb3669de08ee85a9bf9a594b379e9ec3

commit_message:
Set uwsgi threads per worker

I can't find any documentation or log dump about how many threads are
used by default when enable_threads=True (like we have). So set it to
16 to make sure we have at least that many, which should be about 32
total for our CI workers, which should have two processes.

Change-Id: Ie545d5cabcd128c8e3cf68603d1c257c3b35bdbc

commit_message:
Use proper galera port in configuration

While <service>_galera_port is defined and used for db_setup
role, it's not in fact used in a connection string for oslo.db.

Change-Id: If34f937fe46cc3a2f181324c011fa9c9082d41ad

commit_message:
git: git checkout for a commit hash combinated with depth argument

This patch: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/882299
provides functionality, that commit hash can be passed as last arugment,
however when GIT_DEPTH is set, it fails, as in:

timeout -s SIGINT 0 git clone https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn.git ./ovn
--depth 1 --branch 03b95a4566a15f7544f4cdf35629dacede4dcf55
fatal: Remote branch 03b95a4566a15f7544f4cdf35629dacede4dcf55
not found in upstream origin

Closes-Bug: #2023020
Change-Id: I748354964a133e028e12458cc9014d6d014cbdb9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/34/890334/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
PowerFlex: Fix size of volume created from snapshot/cloned volume

Size of volume created from snapshot/cloned volume was not updated
in database to its real size on the storage.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/797966
Closes-Bug: #1935028
Change-Id: Ia965e97bbf9d2bc94a0aa5d6a34a43598a7a8acb

commit_message:
Make centos9s jobs non-voting

The gnocchi install is broken on setuptools delivered
by centos9s, lets make these jobs non-voting until
that is solved to unblock the gate.

Change-Id: I3a5e7d576b3ca5b4adff1bd3a807907e764efeaa

commit_message:
Pin PyYAML<5.4.0

PyYAML fails to build with Cython, this patch pins PyYAML to the latest
version that doesn't use Cython.

Also relax the pinning of charm-tools to allow the use of maintenance
releases.

Related-Bug: #2030789
Change-Id: I5131e6401fced5b509cadf717553fdfcbba07c0a

commit_message:
Pin PyYAML<5.4.0

PyYAML fails to build with Cython, this patch pins PyYAML to the latest
version that doesn't use Cython.

Pin jsonschema<4.18.0, because newer versions depend on Rust (via
rpds-py)

Also relax the pinning of charm-tools to allow the use of maintenance
releases.

Related-Bug: #2030789
Change-Id: I67d6449b4e3c400bd6db49a5b1fb4ef907590490
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-vault refs/changes/08/890808/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cython<3.0 # https://github.com/juju/charm-tools/pull/659

commit_message:
Define libvirt secrets from keyring files in ceph_extra_confs

Previously this required always access to the mon_host of the Ceph
cluster to fetch the key for volume access. Now this key can be defined
through Ceph keyring files.

Change-Id: Ib2c755d38038b14ca3803de1bb9cbcec122eaa83
(cherry picked from commit e7ebbeb5da889e975ea0e6c12c8b0b3810170313)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ceph_client refs/changes/08/891108/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Distribute extra key files from monitor host- name: Create extra key files from keyring files copy: src: "{{ item.keyring_src }}" dest: "/tmp/{{ item.secret_uuid }}{{ item.client_name }}.key.tmp" with_items: "{{ ceph_extra_confs }}" when: - item.keyring_src is defined - item.client_name is defined - item.secret_uuid is defined dest: /tmp/{{ item.secret_uuid }}{{ item.client_name }}-secret.xml command: "virsh secret-define --file /tmp/{{ item.secret_uuid }}{{ item.client_name }}-secret.xml"<<<<<<< HEAD (e1336a Improve regexp for fetching nova secret from files)======= - "'client_name' in item" - "'secret_uuid' in item" - item.secret_uuid not in libvirt_secret_exists.results[index].stdout_lines >>>>>>> CHANGE (e7ebbe Define libvirt secrets from keyring files in ceph_extra_conf)- name: Set extra secret value(s) in libvirt from monitor host- name: Set extra secret value(s) in libvirt from keyring shell: "virsh secret-set-value --secret {{ item.secret_uuid }} --base64 $(awk '/key = /{print $3}' /tmp/{{ item.secret_uuid }}{{ item.client_name }}.key.tmp)" loop: "{{ ceph_extra_confs }}" loop_control: index_var: index when: - "'client_name' in item" - "'keyring_src' in item" - "'secret_uuid' in item" - item.secret_uuid not in libvirt_secret_value_exists.results[index].stdout_lines notify: - Restart os services path: "/tmp/{{ item.secret_uuid }}{{ item.client_name }}-secret.xml" state: "absent" with_items: "{{ ceph_extra_confs }}" when: - item.secret_uuid is defined - item.client_name is defined tags: - always - name: Remove libvirt key file from monitor host file: path: "/tmp/{{ item.mon_host }}{{ item.client_name }}.key.tmp"- name: Remove libvirt key file from keyring file: path: "/tmp/{{ item.secret_uuid }}{{ item.client_name }}.key.tmp" - item.secret_uuid is defined
deleted_lines: - name: Distribute extra key files dest: /tmp/{{ item.mon_host }}{{ item.client_name }}-secret.xml - item.mon_host is defined command: "virsh secret-define --file /tmp/{{ item.mon_host }}{{ item.client_name }}-secret.xml"- name: Set extra secret value(s) in libvirt path: "/tmp/{{ item.mon_host }}{{ item.client_name }}-secret.xml"- name: Remove libvirt key file file: path: "/tmp/{{ item.mon_host }}{{ item.client_name }}.key.tmp" - item.mon_host is defined

commit_message:
Replace	deprecated terms

Following up on	the usage of inclusive jargon [1] and to ensure
consistency in code, there is a need to replace deprecated term
tempest_test_blacklist with a new term tempest_test_exclude_list.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/768583

Change-Id: I1692876c9d42b3ac857fdb61dcdc2caa61cd349d

commit_message:
Use proper galera port in configuration

While <service>_galera_port is defined and used for db_setup
role, it's not in fact used in a connection string for oslo.db.

Change-Id: I6967d3832396f375580039c73510ea4f02002b3b

commit_message:
Fix linters and metadata

With update of ansible-lint to version >=6.0.0 a lot of new
linters were added, that enabled by default. In order to comply
with linter rules we're applying changes to the role.

With that we also update metdata to reflect current state.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ansible-role-systemd_service/+/888223
Change-Id: I30eff91392dcab1e76c4fee89ead7a6e03838b2d

with linter rules we're applying changes to the role.

With that we also update metdata to reflect current state.

commit_message:
Use proper galera port in configuration

Use proper galera port in configuration

While <service>_galera_port is defined and used for db_setup
role, it's not in fact used in a connection string for oslo.db.

Change-Id: I74735ad2f127a4c62d4e5c4d24dd1af76e5b76a3

commit_message:
Use proper galera port in configuration

While <service>_galera_port is defined and used for db_setup
role, it's not in fact used in a connection string for oslo.db.

Change-Id: I795e7a7423d3efd5168dd8e8d89b3c86aa13c31f

This is a patch to start work on re-writing the integration tests
using pytest syntax and several improvements, as proposed on the
upstream meeting, and summarized at https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/horizon-pytest

The new tests are to eventually replace the existing integration
tests. At the moment they don't run automatically, you have to explicitly run them using tox or pytest. When the new tests are complete, we will switch to them on the gate.



Change-Id: Iea38e4f9771ff3cae7ae8675863e9c488f3f6d8a
"}]
commit_message:
Add pytest-based selenium tests

This is a patch to start work on re-writing the integration tests
using pytest syntax and several improvements, as proposed on the
upstream meeting, and summarized at https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/horizon-pytest

The new tests are to eventually replace the existing integration
tests. At the moment they don't run automatically, you have to explicitly run them using tox or pytest. When the new tests are complete, we will switch to them on the gate.



Change-Id: Iea38e4f9771ff3cae7ae8675863e9c488f3f6d8a

commit_message:
[OVN] Retry retrieving LSP hosting information

There's a sync issue while trying to fetch the hosting information for
the LSP before we write it to the OVN database, sometimes the
information is not yet present and we end up with an empty string ("")
for the host attribute of portbindings. This patch adds a retry
mechanism to solve this sync issue.

Change-Id: I52ec4b346271889ebaa7b7f84981eae5503d02d3
Related-Bug: #2020058
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/73/889073/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron._i18n import _from neutron.plugins.ml2 import db as ml2_db @tenacity.retry(retry=tenacity.retry_if_exception_type(RuntimeError), wait=tenacity.wait_random(min=2, max=3), stop=tenacity.stop_after_attempt(3), reraise=True) def _wait_for_port_bindings_host(self, context, db_port): port = ml2_db.get_port(context, db_port.id) # This is already checked previously but, just to stay on # the safe side in case the port is deleted mid-operation if not port: raise RuntimeError( _('No port found with ID %s') % db_port.id) if not port.port_bindings: raise RuntimeError( _('No port bindings information found with for ' 'port %s') % db_port.id) host = port.port_bindings[0].host if not host: raise RuntimeError( _('No hosting information found for port %s') % db_port.id) return port if not db_port.port_bindings or not db_port.port_bindings[0].host: # NOTE(lucasgomes): There might be a sync issue between # the moment that this port was fetched from the database # and the hosting information being set, retry a few times try: db_port = self._wait_for_port_bindings_host( context, db_port) except RuntimeError as e: LOG.warning(e) return host = db_port.port_bindings[0].host
deleted_lines: if not db_port.port_bindings: return host = db_port.port_bindings[0].host

commit_message:
Fix linters and metadata

With update of ansible-lint to version >=6.0.0 a lot of new
linters were added, that enabled by default. In order to comply
with linter rules we're applying changes to the role.

With that we also update metdata to reflect current state.

Change-Id: I1920cd05ac5b4d32ad12bce42d9161a568f288b6

commit_message:
git: git checkout for a commit hash combinated with depth argument

This patch: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/882299
provides functionality, that commit hash can be passed as last arugment,
however when GIT_DEPTH is set, it fails, as in:

timeout -s SIGINT 0 git clone https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn.git ./ovn
--depth 1 --branch 03b95a4566a15f7544f4cdf35629dacede4dcf55
fatal: Remote branch 03b95a4566a15f7544f4cdf35629dacede4dcf55
not found in upstream origin

Closes-Bug: #2023020
Change-Id: I748354964a133e028e12458cc9014d6d014cbdb9

commit_message:
Allow explicit dns server settings for q-dhcp

By default the dhcp agent tries to use the same DNS servers that the
host is configured to use via /etc/resolv.conf. But this only works when
those nameservers are also reachable from the tenant networks, which is
not the case if they use lookback addresses, like when systemd-resolved
is active.

Allow to specify one or multiple other DNS servers instead that the dhcp
agent will use as forwarders when processing DNS queries.

Change-Id: Id8cc78fab4ac66ef369e7c66bdcfa15c588e6421
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/51/733951/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ -n "$Q_DNS_SERVERS" ]]; then iniset $Q_DHCP_CONF_FILE DEFAULT dnsmasq_dns_servers "$Q_DNS_SERVERS" else iniset $Q_DHCP_CONF_FILE DEFAULT dnsmasq_local_resolv True fi
deleted_lines: # make it so we have working DNS from guests iniset $Q_DHCP_CONF_FILE DEFAULT dnsmasq_local_resolv True

commit_message:
Server migration across physical networks via port bindings

This patch provides the support for share server migrations between
hosts on different physical networks. Share server's network may
therefore have different segmentation id's for source and target hosts.
It is achieved by creating an inactive port binding on the target host
during share server migration, and then cut it over to target host when
migration completes. The implementation is driver agnostic, so that this
feature should be not limited to specific driver, although it is only
tested against NetApp driver. The feature is enabled by a new share
service option 'server_migration_extend_neutron_network'. Note
supporting for multiple bindings of Manila ports must be enabled in
neutron ML2 plugin.

Closes-Bug: #2002019
Change-Id: I18d0dd1847a09f28989b1a2b62fc6ff8f8155def

commit_message:
Add tls job to the check pipeline

The job openstack-helm-tls is updated to use 2023.1 release.
Also we renamed the tls job to openstack-helm-tls-2023-1-ubuntu_focal
to make it more convenient. And since this feature is important
we add the job to the check pipeline.

subject: Improve rebuild tests in test_server_actions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-08-08 18:02:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/af3031a70ca9ec28c82ec7c868663810fa72d4cf', 'message': 'Ignore 409 error in detach volume cleanup

There are some test which attach the volume to
the server, detach in test cleanup, and do multiple
operation on server during the test. For example,
rebuild, resize etc. In such tests, there are possibility
that server might stuck somewhere and might not be able to
reach in active state before cleanup of detach volume start.

One example of such issue is test_rebuild_server_with_volume_attached
which is failing in detach volume cleanup due to server
not in active state
- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/2964990aa7ab41caa83c485415fffec5/log/job-output.txt#34435

Change-Id: Ia1a57b4d0127baaa614191cc013115732ca1cceb

test_rebuild_server_with_volume_attached attach
volume and rebuilt the class level server which
is used by other tests also. When anything goes
wrong with the class level server then we do recreate
the server in setup of each test.

Instead of rebuilding the class level server, let's
create its own server and perform the rebuild.

commit_message:
Improve rebuild tests in test_server_actions

Rebuild tests rebuild the class level server which
is used by other tests also and they rebuild it
again on the original image. If anything goes
wrong with the class level server then we do recreate
the server in setup of each test.

Doing so much things on server needed by other tests
and recreate them in setup is too much. Instead of
rebuilding the class level server, let's create its
own server and perform the rebuild.

Also, this test does two ssh validation after rebuild
so removing the one.

This might help the issue where test_rebuild_server_with_volume_attached
is failing in detach volume cleanup due to server not
in active state
- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/2964990aa7ab41caa83c485415fffec5/log/job-output.txt#34435

Change-Id: Ia1a57b4d0127baaa614191cc013115732ca1cceb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/21/890821/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except (lib_exc.NotFound, lib_exc.Conflict): # Ignore 404s, 409 on detach in case the server is deleted, # not in Active state, or the volume is already detached.
deleted_lines: except lib_exc.NotFound: # Ignore 404s on detach in case the server is deleted or the volume # is already detached.

commit_message:
git: git checkout for a commit hash combinated with depth argument

This patch: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/882299
provides functionality, that commit hash can be passed as last arugment,
however when GIT_DEPTH is set, it fails, as in:

timeout -s SIGINT 0 git clone https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn.git ./ovn
--depth 1 --branch 03b95a4566a15f7544f4cdf35629dacede4dcf55
fatal: Remote branch 03b95a4566a15f7544f4cdf35629dacede4dcf55
not found in upstream origin

Closes-Bug: #2023020
Change-Id: I748354964a133e028e12458cc9014d6d014cbdb9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/33/890333/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: git_timed clone --no-checkout $git_clone_flags $git_remote $git_dest git_timed fetch $git_clone_flags origin $git_ref git_timed checkout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Fix metadata agents to parse X-Forwarded-For headers properly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-07-10 20:09:23.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/ovn/metadata/server.py', 'neutron/agent/metadata/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/ovn/metadata/test_server.py', 'neutron/common/utils.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/common/test_utils.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/metadata/test_agent.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/20450e90ef28a1ca31e79cfb4dfd9bb2b196205b', 'message': 'Fix metadata agents to parse X-Forwarded-For headers properly

While looking at an unrelated issue I noticed log lines like
this in the neutron-ovn-metadata-agent log file:

  No port found in network b62452f3-ec93-4cd7-af2d-9f9eabb33b12
  with IP address 10.246.166.21,10.131.84.23

While it might seem harmless, looking at the code it only showed
a single value being logged:

  LOG.error("No port found in network %s with IP address %s",
  network_id, remote_address)

The code in question is looking for a matching IP address, but
will never match the concatenated string.

Google shows the additional IP address(es) that might be present
in this header are actually proxies:

  https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/X-Forwarded-For

And sure enough in my case the second IP was always the same.

The code needs to be changed to account for proxies, which are not
actually necessary to lookup what port is making the request.

Change-Id: I1c9d555ab05784f8c46471b077c7d279c4887e6c
Closes-bug: #2026775
'}]
commit_message:
Fix metadata agents to parse X-Forwarded-For headers properly

While looking at an unrelated issue I noticed log lines like
this in the neutron-ovn-metadata-agent log file:

  No port found in network b62452f3-ec93-4cd7-af2d-9f9eabb33b12
  with IP address 10.246.166.21,10.131.84.23

While it might seem harmless, looking at the code it only showed
a single value being logged:

  LOG.error("No port found in network %s with IP address %s",
  network_id, remote_address)

The code in question is looking for a matching IP address, but
will never match the concatenated string.

Google shows the additional IP address(es) that might be present
in this header are actually proxies:

  https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/X-Forwarded-For

And sure enough in my case the second IP was always the same.

The code needs to be changed to account for proxies, which are not
actually necessary to lookup what port is making the request.

Change-Id: I1c9d555ab05784f8c46471b077c7d279c4887e6c
Closes-bug: #2026775
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/67/888067/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: remote_address, _ = utils.parse_x_forwarded_for(remote_address) def test_get_instance_id_router_id_proxy(self, remote_address): router_id = 'the_id' headers = { 'X-Neutron-Router-ID': router_id } # technically this is not valid with mixed IP versions, but the # proxy value is never used remote_address += ',11.0.0.1' networks = ('net1', 'net2') ports = [ [{'network_id': 'net1'}, {'network_id': 'net2'}], [{'device_id': 'device_id', 'tenant_id': 'tenant_id', 'network_id': 'net1'}] ] self.assertEqual( ('device_id', 'tenant_id'), self._get_instance_and_tenant_id_helper( headers, ports, networks=networks, router_id=router_id, remote_address=remote_address) ) @ddt.data('192.168.1.1', '::ffff:192.168.1.1', 'fe80::5054:ff:fede:5bbf')

commit_message:
Use default timeout and retry for haproxy_amphora

This help to reduce unnecessary tention cause by config override in
openstack helm which sounds like overkill and could cause issues of
getting LBs with stuck operations (for updates or deletes).

Change-Id: I8024bbc169fb9e12cbf2d3df38787e2f8eed39f8

commit_message:
Add exec probe timeouts

As of kubernetes 1.20 exec liveness and readiness probes default to 1
second. See the note here:

https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/configure-liveness-readiness-startup-probes/

This PS adds exec probe timeouts where necessary.

Change-Id: If1de652f0b2bef8dac2e9b306e645930320c67eb

commit_message:
[chromedriver] Amend upstream download link

The upstream changed the structure of the JSON API endpoints
(now they contain both chrome and chromedriver binaries)
https://github.com/GoogleChromeLabs/chrome-for-testing#json-api-endpoints

Change-Id: Idaa38f3c2522f4709c396e99090b7fa6d9790c8d

subject: Restore ServiceAccount to openvswitch pod

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-07-13 21:26:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/commit/5d9ad53047691eda161ac51bcd7d73c461c17153', 'message': "Restore ServiceAccount to openvswitch pod

This change includes back the the helm-toolkit snippet:
kubernetes_pod_rbac_serviceaccount to the openvswitch Daemonset
definition, since it is responsible for creating the POD's
